question.title: Spring Boot Failed to execute goal org.springframework.boot:spring-boot-maven-plugin:3.3.0:run
question.body:
I was following Consuming a RESTful Web Service

and ran this command in the Intellij terminal ./mvnw spring-boot:run

I had an error so I decided to clone the complete project

git clone https://github.com/spring-guides/gs-consuming-rest.git

which is found in the directory gs-consuming-rest/complete but still had the same error. This is the error:

[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.springframework.boot:spring-boot-maven-plugin:3.3.0:run (default-cli) on project consuming-rest-complete: Process terminated with exit code: 1 -> [Help 1] org.apache.maven.lifecycle.LifecycleExecutionException: Failed to execute goal org.springframework.boot:spring-boot-maven-plugin:3.3.0:run (default-cli) on project consuming-rest-complete: Process terminated with exit code: 1

I tried, as suggested in the answer running

./mvnw spring-boot:run -Dspring-boot.run.arguments="--server.port=8081"

and it doesn't work.

What works for me is running the quoters project and then:

./mvnw spring-boot:run "-Dspring-boot.run.arguments=--server.port=8081"

You have to put the double quotes around the whole argument.

answers.body:
I also ran gs-consuming-rest project and got the same error. The full error detail is:

Error starting ApplicationContext. To display the condition evaluation report re-run your application with 'debug' enabled.

2025-07-30T12:26:41.569+07:00 ERROR 12112 --- \[           main\] o.s.boot.SpringApplication               : Application run failed

org.springframework.web.client.HttpClientErrorException$NotFound: 404 : "{"timestamp":"2025-07-30T05:26:41.488+00:00","status":404,"error":"Not Found","path":"/api/random"}"
...

[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] BUILD FAILURE
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[..]
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.springframework.boot:spring-boot-maven-plugin:3.3.0:run (default-cli) on project consuming-rest-complete: Process terminated with exit code: 1 -> [Help 1]

It means that the API http://localhost:8080/api/random is not found. We need to run the project https://github.com/spring-guides/quoters to provide the API as mentioned in the article.

You can try running quoters project on Command Prompt:

git clone https://github.com/spring-guides/quoters.git --depth 1
cd quoters
mvnw package
java -jar target/quoters-incorporated-0.0.1-SNAPSHOT.jar

Now run gs-consuming-rest project again in another terminal window:

cd gs-consuming-rest/complete

# For Command Prompt:
mvnw spring-boot:run -Dspring-boot.run.arguments="--server.port=8081"

# For PowerShell:
./mvnw spring-boot:run '-Dspring-boot.run.arguments="--server.port=8081"'

In the last command, we need to specify another port for gs-consuming-rest as the default port 8080 is already used by quoters. I tried these commands on Command Prompt.

The final output is:

mvnw spring-boot:run -Dspring-boot.run.arguments="--server.port=8081"

[...]
  .   ____          _            __ _ _
 /\\ / ___'_ __ _ _(_)_ __  __ _ \ \ \ \
( ( )\___ | '_ | '_| | '_ \/ _` | \ \ \ \
 \\/  ___)| |_)| | | | | || (_| |  ) ) ) )
  '  |____| .__|_| |_|_| |_\__, | / / / /
 =========|_|==============|___/=/_/_/_/

 :: Spring Boot ::                (v3.3.0)

[...]
2025-07-30T12:43:36.039+07:00  INFO 6080 --- [           main] c.e.c.ConsumingRestApplication           : Quote[type=success, value=Value[id=11, quote=I have two hours today to build an app from scratch. @springboot to the rescue!]]

question_comments.body: @andrewJames At first I didn't run github.com/spring-guides/quotes but I did run it eventually and I am still getting the same error. I'll try running it again and get back to you

One way to get this error is if you forgot to run the separate web application which provides random stock quotes. The application you are trying to run consumes data from that other application. See the "Fetching a REST Resource" section in this page and follow the directions there: "you need a source of REST resources. We have provided an example of such a service at github.com/spring-guides/quoters. You can run that application in a separate terminal and access the result at localhost:8080/api/random."

79719489.body: @MasumKazi "The term 'mvnw' is not recognized as the name of a cmdlet..." => this is PowerShell's error message. I think running command again with syntax "./mvnw ..." should work.

Here is my problem.    [INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------‌​------------  [ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.springframework.boot:spring-boot-maven-plugin:3.5.5:run (default-cli) on project fcmis-API: Process terminated with exit code: 1 -> [Help 1]    '    And after running your command, I got these errors    mvnw : The term 'mvnw' is not recognized as the name of a cmdlet, function, script file, or operable program.

By default, IntelliJ opens PoweShell in Terminal. I think you ran the command on PoweShell. For PoweShell, we need to use quoting like this: ./mvnw spring-boot:run '-Dspring-boot.run.arguments="--server.port=8081"' Please see this for more information: stackoverflow.com/a/6351739/9613844 For Command Prompt: mvnw spring-boot:run -Dspring-boot.run.arguments="--server.port=8081" For Git Bash: ./mvnw spring-boot:run -Dspring-boot.run.arguments="--server.port=8081"

I tried and am getting this error: [ERROR] Unknown lifecycle phase ".run.arguments=--server.port=8081". You must specify a valid lifecycle phase or a goal in the format <plugin-p refix>:<goal> or <plugin-group-id>:<plugin-artifact-id>[:<plugin-version>]:<g‌​oal>. Available lifecycle phases are: pre-clean, clean, post-clean , validate, initialize, generate-sources, process-sources, generate-resources, process-resources, compile, process-classes, generate-test-sourc es, process-test-sources, generate-test-resources, process-test-resources, test-compile, process-test-classes, test,
